item.title: 001 Two Sum
item.description: Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. Example: Given nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9, Because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9, return [0, 1]. @Slf4j public class TwoSum { public int[] twoSum(int[] numbers, int target) { int[] result = new int[2]; Map<Integer, Integer> map = new HashMap<>(); for (int i = 0; i < numbers.
